args: Tch... He's still not here.\nDeal time's long since passed.
I'm afraid your ＂business partner＂\nwon't be coming.
Who are you people? And what do you\nmean, they ain't coming?
They're currently occupied with disclosing\ndetails of your illicit dealings to our allies.
You're the sylvan information broker who\ntold them where to find medicinal herbs,\ncorrect?
You will atone for your crimes against the\nmother forest.
Crimes? Bah ha ha! What are you on\nabout, guy? It's called an effective use\nof resources!

Medicinal herbs grow all over the place.
They ain't gonna disappear if we go pickin'
'em, so it'd be a waste if I didn't make
some coin offa it!
That's why you started selling information\nabout them to black marketeers?
Money makes the world go 'round, pal.\nNo point hoardin' stuff that folks are willin'\nto pay top value for.
Sylvans're a buncha buttheads, if you ask\nme. Sittin' on a veritable goldmine and\njust holing up among the trees...
Bastard! You would dare besmirch the\npeople of the wood's—hrm?
You gonna finish that thought, pretty boy,\nor should I finish it for ya?
Quiet. I sense footsteps—fiends. A whole\nhorde of them is headed this way!\nEveryone, draw your weapons!
Those ears of yours are as sharp as ever,\nIsaac! You really saved our bacon there.
Any guardsman of the verdure would be\nable to do as much. More importantly,\nwhere has the information broker gone?!
Oh! There's the little weasel! He tried\nto slip away while we were fighting!
Heh, guess my luck hasn't run out after all,\nwhat with those fiends showin' up when\nthey—
I do as the mother forest bids me.\nThough you bring harm to the woods,\nyou live among them just the same.
The forest is granting you a chance to\nright your wrongs.
What ＂wrongs＂? I'm just using\nit efficiently, like I told you—
Could you hold fast to that excuse if at the\nendpoint of your actions laid the forest's\ndeath?
Huh? What's that supposed to mean?

I have been to inspect the herb patches
that you guided profiteers to ravage.
Each crop had been plucked, root and all,
before they could sow their seeds.
That land will remain forever fallow.
What?! There's no way! The other\nsylvans pick those herbs all the time!
Because they have rules laid down which\nprotect the workings of nature, inoculating\nthe land's bounty against exhaustion.
It seems to me that you have been\nincorrectly assuming that such plant\nlife grows without significant effort.
You and your ilk, selling information,\nhave thought of nothing but money.

Were you to stay the course, it would spell
the destruction of the forest, and then
countless creatures, sylvans included,
will lose their home.

Seeing that you have some familiarity with
the land, you must hail from this place too.
Know that your actions portend only doom
for the land you call home.
Surely you grew up playing in the woods.\nWould you feel nothing if the mother forest\nthat raised you died at your own hand?

If you have any heart left for Mother
Nature, return to your home village and
repent. There yet remains a way back
from this destructive path you've tread.
The woods yet cling to life,\nin all their stubborn glory.
...And that is the full story of this event.
Permit me to thank you for your aid in\nresolving the situation. What a deplorable\nstate of affairs we find ourselves in.
I cannot believe that a fellow sylvan would\nresort to selling off the wood's blessings...

We must enact a rule which ensures that
this manner of erring shall never repeat.
And we will need to strictly manage our
precious herbs—
Elder. Perhaps we could spread their\ncultivation techniques beyond the woods\ninstead.
Wh-what are you saying?! We are law-\nbound to protect these herbs and plants!\nAre you making light of that precept?!
Not in the slightest. Our laws are the\nculmination of our ancestral wisdom.\nThey should be treated with care.

But here, your stubbornness in adhering
to those laws has become a shackle,
risking the livelihood of the very thing
you wish to protect.

Because our laws shrouded them in
secrecy, the medicinal herbs were
treated as highly valuable commodities,
and as a result, this incident occurred.

But if we did away with that rule and
spread our cultivation techniques wide,
they would cease being a rare commodity,
decreasing their black market value.

Hmph. You venture overmuch. Humans
cannot raise the herbs, and the wider we
spread word of them, the more the forest
will suffer in turn.

Wrong. In the past, we laid down rules
because cultivating the herbs was difficult.
But modern farming techniques have
advanced far more than you realize.
Rgh... But even so, the herbs are the\nblessing of the woods made manifest!\nThey are a sylvan treasure!
We have cultivated these treasures over\nlong years, and to give them to strangers\nwho have made no such efforts...!

You would adhere to that belief even if it
meant losing that treasure altogether?
Even this most recent incident alone has
razed several herb varieties from the earth.
Meanwhile, the camirela endures. Because\nit has been cultivated at the Halidom, its\nseeds can be sown once more.

Will you uphold our laws as they are and
repeat the same mistakes? Or amend them
for the sake of protecting the forest? What
will you bequeath to the next generation?
I understand your reluctance to change.\nI was the same until just recently.

But you have nothing to fear. Even if the
laws change, your heart—your desire to
safeguard the woods you call home—
never will.
...Hm.\nAmend our laws to protect the forest...
Cooperate with the prince of the Halidom\nand teach the cultivation method for the\ncamirela to all who would learn.
And then...I need you to deliver a letter to\nthe Halidom. I must apologize to that\nhuman.
Of course. I will also have camirela seeds\nbrought here.
You have my gratitude for your\nunderstanding.
All we do, we do to leave a healthy and\nvigorous forest for future generations.\nI did what I ought.

Young though you may be, you truly speak
with the wood's best interests at heart.
You have taught me a profound lesson.
And with that, I am off.
You're one heck of a guy, Isaac.\nYou convinced that stubborn old elder\nto see reason.
I was simply making use of what I learned\nat the Halidom.
Identifying what needs to change and what\nneeds to be maintained is necessary for\nprotecting our traditions and culture.
I would never have learned that had I\nremained in Initio forever. Thank you\nfor broadening my horizons.
Hee hee! No thanks necessary, bub.
After all, no matter where we hail from,\nwe're all sylvans!
Yeah. And we want to see our sylvan\nculture passed on, the same as you.
Sarisse... Luca...\nI am glad I met you both.
Come once more to the holy land to visit.\nYggdrasil and I will welcome you both.
Yeah! We will for sure! It's a promise.
And until that time comes, I'll protect Initio\nwith all I have to give—I swear it on my\ntitle as a guardsman of the verdure.
